personal_info.name: Victoria Hall
personal_info.headline: Freelance Graphic Designer & Illustrator
personal_info.summary: I am an innovative and diverse freelance Graphic Designer & Illustrator, with over 10 years experience across a wide range of creative industries.  My studies began in college with a BTEC in Fashion and Textiles, followed by a degree in Fashion Design at the critically acclaimed, Nottingham Trent University.  Following graduation, I began my career as a Graphics and Print Designer in the Fashion and Creative Industries, which has seen me located in various places across the UK, as well as relocating to New York City. Whilst at these various locations, I’ve been lucky enough to design for some of the largest companies in the world;  including Walmart, Tesco, Asda, Wilkinsons and Clinton's Cards, amongst many others. My designs have spanned a diversity of products, including marketing material, promotional literature, branding, POS, Fashion, Greeting Cards, Activity products, Giftware, Stationery, Partyware, Underwear … to name but a few. As well as my background in Design, I’ve also had some invaluable Fashion Business and PR/Marketing opportunities; working for businesses such as a Creative Marketing Consultation Agency, and a Global Dutch Womenswear Fashion Company. These opportunities gave me the chance to deal with retail giants such as Harvey Nichols, John Lewis and House of Fraser, as well as media headliners such as Drapers and Vogue.  As well as Victoria Hall Design, I also continue to run my “Little Sister” business Polka Dot Bikini, which offers unique and innovative personalised design and gifts.

volunteering.title: Fund raiser and representative
volunteering.description: I organised an event to raise funds and awareness to the plight of the European Wolf, raising needed funds to help maintain the Grupo Lobo wolf sanctuary in Portugal. I ran over 250 miles across the Scottish Highlands, from Peterhead to Oban with my Siberian Husky Miskoe. The challenge was to complete the trek within 7 days. We completed the event running 10 marathons over the period of 6 days raising a substantial amount of money for the charity.

volunteering.title: Fund raiser and representative
volunteering.description: I  met Johnny and Dave via Todd Jones, having always admired the efforts these guys put in to help secure the safety of such a majestic beast from extinction, I felt compelled to do something. I ran my first marathon in the famous rhino suit in March 94 Los Angeles. Then over the period of 10 years ran 10 London's, 1 Great North Run, 1 Three Peaks Challenge, 1, 24 hour Lakeland challenge and 2 of the infamous Comrades Marathon an 80km ultra distance foot race in South Africa. Many painful but happy days and great memories, keep up the good work guys.

volunteering.title: Fund Raiser and Event Organiser
volunteering.company: Conservation Group studying endangered European Predators
volunteering.description: An expedition to run 2 dog teams (16 Huskies) 400 miles across the Alps from Chamonix in France,  to Saltzburg in Austria. The exhibition took 2 years to organise, which included organising sponsorship of equipment, transport, media interest, team (Anglo/German). The event was difficult due to poor snow fall meaning the sleds had to run on much smaller and dangerous trails through the mountains. The event was successful in its start to finish goals but unfortunately and very disappointingly due to lack of media interest on completion of the event targeted raised funds fell well short of our goals.
